images.caption: European Hornbeam – leaves have a distinct venation and are bent along the veins; male flowers are in yellowish, pendant catkins
European Hornbeam – fruits are supplied with distinct three-lobed bracts, working as a flying organ
European Hornbeam – the bark is dark grey, smooth in the beginning, later slightly cracked
European Hornbeam – leaves, flowers and fruits; colorized drawing by Josef Dohnal
